column4: Hope someone has insight: Fresh install of Kubuntu 9.10, no sound at all. In KMix enabled all channels, none are muted and volume turned up. lspci reports Creative Labs CA0106 Soundblaster. Seems to be loaded fine. aplay -l reports the sound device, Configure Desktop > Multimedia > Device > Test gives no sound, no login sound, no app sounds. Pulse audio is not installed (surprisingly was not by default), ran purge pulseaudio to be sure. Ma
nually added user to group 'audio'. Still nothing. Ideas? Thanks
use asoundconf to set your soundcard
Also, if you have an ATI card, make sure snd_hda_intel isn't loaded
One odd note, when I run aplay -l it repeats the card's entry 4 times.
asoundconf does not seem to exist
you'll need to get the package from jaunty repos, it was removed in karmic
How should I pull in the package from jaunty repo?
Hmm, the sound card is already listed as device 0
I'm stumped, normally the inorrect soundcard is selected or another is in the default spot
I'm stumped too. This is a real headache (customer's machine, if it wasn't bad enough!) Thanks for trying to help though
Have you double checked sliders and mute boxes?
dumb question, I know, but some soundcards require weird settings in alsa-mixer
Quadruple-checked, every channel is shown, unmuted and turned up, except for IEC958, which has no slider at all. *shrug*
